intro: Elaphoglossum ekmanii, commonly known as the Ekman's holly fern, is a small, delicate fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, leathery fronds that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces spores in clusters on the underside of its leaves, a feature common among ferns. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
